org.dancres.blitz.jini.lockmgr
Interface LockManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
DistributedLockManager
public interface LockManager

LockManager represents generic lock manager that allows obtaining and releasing locks on objects.

Author:
Roman Rokytskyy (rrokytskyy@acm.org)

Method Summary
 void delete(java.lang.Object lockId, long aTimeout)
          Delete a resource held against a particular lock id.
 java.io.Serializable getResource(java.lang.Object lockId)

          Store a resource against a particular lock id for later recovery via getResource.

          Obtain lock on obj for specified owner.
 void unlock(java.lang.Object obj, java.lang.Object owner, net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction aTxn)

Method Detail

lock

public void lock(java.lang.Object obj,
                 java.lang.Object owner,
                 long timeout,
                 net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction aTxn)
          throws LockNotGrantedException,
                 ChannelException
Obtain lock on obj for specified owner. Implementation should try to obtain lock few times within the specified timeout.

Parameters:
obj - obj to lock, usually not full object but object's ID.
owner - object identifying entity that will own the lock.
timeout - maximum time that we grant to obtain a lock.
aTxn - the transaction to take this lock under
Throws:
LockNotGrantedException - if lock is not granted within specified period.
java.lang.ClassCastException - if obj and/or owner is not of type that implementation expects to get (for example, when distributed lock manager obtains non-serializable obj or owner).
ChannelException - if something bad happened to communication channel.

insert

public void insert(java.lang.Object lockId,
                   long aTimeout,
                   java.io.Serializable aResource)
            throws LockNotGrantedException,
                   ChannelException

Store a resource against a particular lock id for later recovery via getResource.

Note insert will fail if a lock is currently held or is about to be asserted against that id.

Throws:
LockNotGrantedException
ChannelException

delete

public void delete(java.lang.Object lockId,
                   long aTimeout)
            throws LockNotReleasedException,
                   ChannelException

Delete a resource held against a particular lock id.

This operation will fail whilst a lock is actively held against the lock id.

Throws:
LockNotReleasedException
ChannelException

getResource

public java.io.Serializable getResource(java.lang.Object lockId)

unlock

public void unlock(java.lang.Object obj,
                   java.lang.Object owner,
                   net.jini.core.transaction.Transaction aTxn)
            throws LockNotReleasedException,
                   ChannelException
Release lock on obj owned by specified owner.

Parameters:
obj - obj to lock, usually not full object but object's ID.
owner - object identifying entity that will own the lock.
Throws:
LockOwnerMismatchException - if lock is owned by another object.
java.lang.ClassCastException - if obj and/or owner is not of type that implementation expects to get (for example, when distributed lock manager obtains non-serializable obj or owner).
ChannelException - if something bad happened to communication channel.
LockNotReleasedException
